newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Lufthansa to fly 30T of drugs supplies to Budapest.
newsitem.headline: Lufthansa to fly 30T of drugs supplies to Budapest.

text.p: German national airline Lufthansa AG said on Monday it planned to fly a Boeing B747-200F cargo airplane into Budapest in early May to deliver roughly 30 tonnes of raw material from India for Hungary's pharmaceutical industry.

The plane, which has cargo capacity of 102 tonnes, will arrive from New Delhi on a flight normally scheduled to connect direct to Frankfurt, said Peter Mojen, director of the Budapest office of the airline's subsidiary Lufthansa Cargo AG.

"The plane will be re-routed to stop in Budapest to make things easier for our customers in Hungary," Mojen told Reuters. "The plane will continue to Frankfurt, and we plan to load it in Budapest with cargo for Germany and onwards."

It is uncommon for 747s to fly into Budapest Ferihegy Airport, where the largest airplanes flying scheduled routes are Boeing B767s, though cargo-only flights are occasionally chartered from Budapest on Antonov An-124s or Ilyushin Il-76s.
"The shipment from India highlights the airport's ability to handle professionally freight from all kinds of airplanes, including large volumes of highly valuable goods," Mojen said.
Details about the raw material were unavailable, he said.
